page.title: 12ECOLOGY: EAST YAR RIVER.
page.content: The extreme S.E. part of our block is crossed by the E.Yar River on its way to Bembridge. This river forms the eastern boundary to Lavenders Farm and Bridge Farm. Near the bridge in Beacon Alley the river's average width is 2m. Its average depth is 41cm.The river has a muddy bottom and frogs can be found. Between "Rainbow's End"(a small holding) and Lavenders Farm, a path leads to the river where a water mill once worked. The mill is in ruins; there are only three walls standing and a bit of the roof. The water wheel is still there. Near the ruins a wooden bridge stands over the river but, funnily enough, there is a brick bridge underneath. Downstream there are a few drainage pipes leading into the river. Pigs wallow happily in the mud!
